title: Our America's Cup challenger 'Britannia' is a wonderful nod to this country's maritime history
text:
It was an incredibly special day for the team today. Almost exactly two years after Team New Zealand announced that the 36th America’s Cup would return to monohulls, and 18 months after they announced the full AC75 class rule, we launched our first race boat.

I’m biased of course but I think Britannia - the name chosen by INEOS Team UK owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe in homage to the iconic racing cutter yacht ‘Britannia’ - is a wonderful acknowledgement of our maritime history.

The original yacht Britannia was built in 1893 for King Edward VII, then the Prince of Wales, and she enjoyed a long and distinguished racing career, competing with and against many America’s Cup boats of her era, including...
description: It was an incredibly special day for the team today.
